page.title: 06Dundrennan Primary School
page.content: The earliest records we have of a school in Dundrennan are dated 1746. At the moment there are 27 pupils and 2 teachers. We also have 3 visiting teachers and a cleaner,who also helps in the dinner hall. The school has 2 classrooms, a hall and 3 cloakrooms and a dining hall, which is on the opposite side of the road from the school.The dinners are brought by bus from Kirkcudbright, 8km away. There is a tarred playing area, and we also have use of the adjoining playing field. Pupils stay here for seven years and then they transfer to Kirkcudbright Academy.
